content.raw: Any reason to define this variable here? Looks like it is not used in the patch?
content.html: Any reason to define this variable here? Looks like it is not used in the patch?

content.raw: There is no else clause to control a possible error in the connection. Is this the desired behaviour?
content.html: There is no else clause to control a possible error in the connection. Is this the desired behaviour?

content.raw: Maybe I was too lazy to look deeper into the code, but t can not easily understand what are these two lines doing? Maybe worth a comment?
content.html: Maybe I was too lazy to look deeper into the code, but t can not easily understand what are these two lines doing? Maybe worth a comment?

content.raw: Which is the reason to use this duplicate ```if (NOT GZIP)``` in line 10 and 11?
content.html: Which is the reason to use this duplicate if (NOT GZIP) in line 10 and 11?

update.description:
All command line tools have been refactored into one unified tool: gz. This matches functionality of other tools, like hg and git.

The usage is now: `gz <command> [options]`, where <commands> are string like "topic", "log", "joint", etc.

A complete list of commands is available by using gz with no arguments.

Help on each command is available using gz help <command>

Tab completion is also in effect. You'll need to manually install this file using: `sudo cp tools/gazebo.bash-completion /etc/bash_completion.d/`. This file will be installed when installing from [debian](#!/osrf/gazebo-release/pull-request/12/support-to-install-bash-completion-script/diff).

**08:15 Feb 25, 2014**: [Jenkins Build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/294/)
update.title: New command line tool

content.raw: I made pull request #990 targeting gazebo_2.2 to fix a test failure when using sdf_1.5. It has some conflicts with this branch, but I've resolved them in 0d0b3268af3c (branch gzmodify_1.5) if you'd like to merge with that.
content.html: I made pull request #990 targeting gazebo_2.2 to fix a test failure when using sdf_1.5. It has some conflicts with this branch, but I've resolved them in 0d0b3268af3c (branch gzmodify_1.5) if you'd like to merge with that.
